proper noun.description: A city in central England, on the Soar River; population 294,900 (est. 2009).

noun.description: A kind of mild, firm cheese, typically orange-colored and originally made in Leicestershire.
A sheep of a breed often crossed with other breeds to produce lambs for the meat industry.
A sheep of a breed similar to the Border Leicester, but with finer wool and a darker face.
